title: Tuscany between Past and Present: A Literary, Historical, Cultural, and Geographical Journey
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description: 8-week program: based in Siena, Italy. Critically discuss the Tuscan imagery, as expressed in literature, history, art, architecture, science, and folklore, with a special focus on Siena. The study material will include literary and historical readings, cinematic representations of Tuscany, in-depth tours of the cityâ€™s monuments and museums. Through a close analysis of different kinds of genres and authors, from poems to satirical magazines, from Giovanni Boccaccio to Dino Campana, the course will explore the richness of the Tuscan cultural history and its influence on the Italian culture tout court. Prerequisite: ITAL 120 (Elementary Italian II) or equivalent proficiency. Must be taken in conjunction with ITAL S130 and ITAL S140. Enrollment limited. Application deadline:February 15. Students are responsible for arranging travel to and from Siena and all other program expenses beyond tuition. For further details, such as program costs, prerequisites, exact dates, credits, etc., visit https://studyabroad.yale.edu/programs/yale-summer-session-siena-intermediate on the Yale Study Abroad website.
